meanings.definition: Incapable of being taken by assault; unconquerable.
meanings.sent1: The castle's walls were so strong and inexpugnable that no enemy could breach them.
meanings.sent2: The fortress was considered inexpugnable due to its strategic location and sturdy defenses.
meanings.sent3: The knight joked that his shield was inexpugnable against even the fiercest dragon's flames.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as inexpugnable as a mountain standing firm against the winds of change.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ancient warrior standing tall and inexpugnable in battle was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being overcome or subdued; invincible.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's powers made him seem inexpugnable to any villain who dared to challenge him.
meanings.sent2: Despite facing numerous obstacles, her spirit remained inexpugnable, driving her to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent3: The team's bond was so strong that their friendship felt inexpugnable, like an unbreakable chain.
meanings.sent4: His confidence in his abilities was as inexpugnable as a shield protecting him from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The image of the undefeated champion standing tall and inexpugnable in the arena inspired awe in the spectators.
